info.name: Eurekos API
info.description:
# Authentication
## OAuth 2.0 authorization flow

Eurekos API use the OAuth 2.0 protocol for authentication and authorization. Currently only client credentials scenario is supported.

### Obtaining access token

`POST oauth2/token`

This method allows to obtain an OAuth access token.

#### Parameters  
| Name          | Default value						|
| ------------- |-----------------------------------|
| grant_type	| client_credentials				|
| client_id     | Client ID provided by Eurekos		|
| client_secret | Client Secret provided by Eurekos |
| scope         | default							|

response.name: {{domain}}/api/{{version}}/courses

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Content-Encoding
header.description: The type of encoding used on the data.

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Transfer-Encoding
header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-Powered-By
header.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)

header.name: X-UA-Compatible
header.description: Custom header

response.body: {"data":[{"nid":"3576","title":"Creating a course","language":"English","flag":"0","label":false},{"nid":"3631","title":"Nutrition: Healthy food for better living","language":"English","flag":"0","label":false},{"nid":"3658","title":"Effective use of lesson materials","language":"English","flag":"0","label":false},{"nid":"3719","title":"PRINCE2 Foundation - English","language":"English","flag":"0","label":false}],"meta":{"totalPages":1}}

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter
